CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 1 reads: "Platform Guests - Following an auto-torchlight parade of 108 cars throughout the 13th Ward, Tuesday night, approximately 1,500 voters jammed into Westinghouse High School auditorium to hear the speakers and platform guests, above, back committeemen and women candidates who are pledged to unseat Ward Chairman Sara Kirk by electing Atty. Linn Washington. Left to right: Rev. Augustus C. Sumpter, St. James AME Church; Rev. J.A. Williams, Baptist Temple Church; Father W.H. Parker, Church of the Holy Cross; Robert Mosley, vocalist; Atty. Stanley Valadez of the AMVETS, Atty. Eric Springer, Atty. Richard F. Jones, Erroll Davis, "Rebels" campaign manager, and Attorney Washington.  An interested crowd of eager persons listened intently and applauded enthusiastically as the speakers rapped "Deficiencies" in present ward leadership. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Rev. Augustus C. Sumpter, Rev. J. A. Williams, Father W. H. Parker, Robert Mosley or Mosely, Atty. Stanley Valadez, Atty. Eric Springer, Atty. Richard F. Jones, Erroll Davis, and Atty. Linn Washington, seated for meeting of the 13th Ward "Rebels," Westinghouse High School Auditorium
